definition: to decrease in force or intensity
examples: waiting for the storm to abate

definition: to become defeated or become null or void (as of a writ or appeal)
to decrease in amount or value
to reduce in degree or intensity : moderate
examples: may abate their rancor to win peace

definition: to reduce in value or amount : to make less especially by way of relief
to beat down or cut away so as to leave a figure in relief
